issue.title: Confusing comment in build.gradle
issue.body:
This snippet says that it can be omitted and is just there for showing how to configure the vaadin plugin:

https://github.com/vaadin/base-starter-gradle/blob/v23/build.gradle#L28-L33

But the [documentation](https://vaadin.com/docs/latest/flow/guide/start/gradle#all-options) says that `pnpmEnable` defaults to true.

What is right here?

issue.title: [multi-select-combo-box] Input value is not selected when using a data provider
issue.body:
### Description

When using a data provider function, entering a predefined value in the input field and committing it with <kbd>Enter</kbd> or blur does not select the value. Also the input field is not cleared.

### Expected outcome

The item corresponding to the input value should be selected, and the input field should be cleared.

### Minimal reproducible example

```html
<vaadin-multi-select-combo-box></vaadin-multi-select-combo-box>
```

```js
  const comboBox = document.querySelector('vaadin-multi-select-combo-box');
  const items = [
    { id: 1, name: 'Hydrogen' },
    { id: 2, name: 'Helium' },
    { id: 3, name: 'Lithium' },
    { id: 4, name: 'Beryllium' },
    { id: 5, name: 'Boron' },
    { id: 6, name: 'Carbon' },
    { id: 7, name: 'Nitrogen' },
    { id: 8, name: 'Oxygen' },
    { id: 9, name: 'Fluorine' }
  ];

  comboBox.itemIdPath = 'id';
  comboBox.itemLabelPath = 'name';
  comboBox.dataProvider = ({filter}, callback) => {
    const filteredItems = items.filter(item => item.name.toLowerCase().includes(filter.toLowerCase()))
    callback(filteredItems, filteredItems.length);
  }
```


### Steps to reproduce

- Focus the input field
- Enter `Helium`
- Press <kbd>Enter</kbd> or blur the field
- The item is not selected
- The input value is not cleared, however if the value was entered in different casing, then the input value is changed to use the exact label of the item
- Moving the focus in the overlay using the arrow keys and pressing <kbd>Enter</kbd> does also not select any item

### Environment

Vaadin version(s): 23.1.beta-4

### Browsers

Issue is not browser related

comment.body:
It's likely related to the multi-select combo box not closing on enter. One option to fix this could be to adapt this observer:
https://github.com/vaadin/web-components/blob/9f0cee9d55af1d2dab368b58f5830109b6ab10f6/packages/combo-box/src/vaadin-combo-box-mixin.js#L679-L690
The observer is triggered whenever the dropdown opens, not when the opened state of the combo box changes. The dropdown briefly closes every time when changing the filter of the combo box, or commiting a value, due to a problematic observer in the dropdown. That alone causes some noticable flickering, and also triggers the observer above. It might be that we want to reset `_lastCommittedValue` only when the actual opened state of the combo box changes.

The other option would be to fix the dropdown briefly closing while the data provider mixin clears the cache, which would also solve the flicking issue. The logic here is flawed in that it doesn't account for the fact that this will be called multiple times while the data provider mixin clears its cache, before it finally sets loading flag to true:
https://github.com/vaadin/web-components/blob/9f0cee9d55af1d2dab368b58f5830109b6ab10f6/packages/combo-box/src/vaadin-combo-box-dropdown.js#L199-L207
Could either set the loading flag beforehand, or maybe debounce the observer so that it doesn't run 5 times while the data provider mixin refreshes data.

issue.title: fix: Always get url mapping using helpers when using Spring Boot
issue.body:
The properties in application.properties use a relaxed mapping strategy in
Spring Boot so all variants of "url-mapping","urlmapping","urlMapping" are
mapped to the same value in VaadinConfigurationProperties.

Fixes https://github.com/vaadin/spring/issues/478

pull_request.title: fix: Always get url mapping using helpers when using Spring Boot
pull_request.body:
The properties in application.properties use a relaxed mapping strategy in
Spring Boot so all variants of "url-mapping","urlmapping","urlMapping" are
mapped to the same value in VaadinConfigurationProperties.

Fixes https://github.com/vaadin/spring/issues/478
